title: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information Leads to administrator access
vulnerability_information:
The weakness of the program is Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information through URL Leads to administrator access. This program is having one feature like we can add users like administrator and read-only, these are roles, into organizations. Here I get the administrator role at same organization by removing the original user id.

Vulnerable URL:  https%3A%2F%2Fconsole.helium.com%2Fusers

Steps to Reproduce:
1. After creating the account for your organization, go to the Users tab and here you can see your organization name on the top, now try to add a user by using the mail id with the role of the administration.
2. Then the opposite user will receive the invitation link from the first user, Click on the invitation link it will take you into the registration page of Console.helium.com, but here thing is, just go to URL of current page here you can see the organization name, inviter id and also invite receiver id and change the mail id of receiver and click on enter.
3. Now, you able to see the registration page again with different mail id in the field of the username and create a password for this id and click on the Register button.
4. Now, this last mail id will receive a confirmation link to complete the registration process, for this go to the mailbox and click on the link and after trying to log in.
5. After a successful login to the account, you can see the organization name of the inviter. Now you are also one the administrator of this organization.
6. To confirm this, go to a first user account who invited into the administrator role, here you can able see the mail id of the last user instead of the real one.
7. Yesâ€¦ we have successfully done it.

## Impact

Full administrator account take over.


Severity:
Critical

activities.message:
Hi @kdr9666, 

Thank you for the report! Unfortunately, we need a little more information from you before we can fully validate this report. 
Please provide a detailed proof of concept that includes the following:
* How to find the vulnerable functionality
* Steps to reproduce the issue
* Any code snippets/curl commands/request and response headers that will help reproduce the issue
* Any additional content such as screenshots/videos that will help demonstrate the vulnerability

Providing this information when submitting new reports will help us to quickly determine the validity of your report. Thank you for your help!

Regards, 
@staple

Hi @staple 

How to find vulnerable functionality:

The weakness of this program is the plaintext transmission of sensitive data through URL which is at the invitation link used to add users into their organization(After creating one account at helium, which is admin account, with the organization name)like admin role and read-only role, by changing few things at the received invitation link, we(attacker) can get administration role in their organization instead of original user who received invitation link

Steps to reproduce the issue:
1. After creating the account for your organization, go to the Users tab and here you can see your organization name on the top, now try to add a user by using their mail id with the role of the administration.
2. Then the opposite(original user) user will receive the invitation link, Click on the invitation link it will take you into the registration page of Console.helium.com, but here thing is, just go to URL of current page here you can see the organization name, inviter id(who invites you to their organization) and also original user id (who receives the invitation) and change the mail id of original user id to different one (attacker id)  and click on enter.
3. Now here you can see the attacker id in the field of a username and create the password for this account and click on the account confirmation link which is already received into the mailbox.
4. And now login to the account(attacker account), then you can see the Organization name of the user who sends this invitation link and now you are also the admin of the organization.
5. For the confirmation purpose, open the user account, who invites firstly. here you can see the list of administration users( first user and attacker user both are the administrators of the Organization).

Over view:

Original Invitation link is ----> https://console.helium.com/register?invitation=3JNIeTdjBxNJR6cNrRxYIvCR_cxCNQ4yrsvYYL8NADb_cg2vv83L29d5y9SBj7uL&
organization_name=%22>&inviter=devender.bugcrowd@gmail.com&email=soxopo3012@hxqmail.com
Here, 
organization_name=  ">
inviter=    devender.bugcrowd@gmail.com
email= soxopo3012@hxqmail.com--------- (Original user id)
Now change this original user mail id to different user mail id to get administration  access to the organization name is ">
here different user(attacker) mail id is gilmetispa@enayu.com
Modified  Invitation link is ----> 
https://console.helium.com/register?invitation=3JNIeTdjBxNJR6cNrRxYIvCR_cxCNQ4yrsvYYL8NADb_cg2vv83L29d5y9SBj7uL&
organization_name=%22>&inviter=devender.bugcrowd@gmail.com&email=gilmetispa@enayu.com
In the First user account we see this below,
gilmetispa@enayu.com-->	Administrator	---> March 9, 2020	
gilmetispa@enayu.com this user got administator role at the Organization: ">
So finaly....
email=soxopo3012@hxqmail.com id don't have any role at the Organization: ">



I hope you understand these steps. Still, if you have any doubts please watch video and screenshots are attached.
Video Drive Link also provided,
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1DuC0rCkjTnA0ziueamOLZKNjWN2lN9wE
Thank You,

Regards,
@kdr9666

Hi @coco-helium 
I have been waiting for your response, could you please let me know if any update.

Hai @coco-helium 
Thank you for your bounty.
Can you add my friend ( @loopspell)  to this conversation?

Hi @coco-helium 
Yes, I have received the bounty $100, which means severity level should be exact medium, but here the severity level is medium to high because of this weakness is chained with cleartext transmission of sensitive info.
Could you please increase my bounty.

Hi @victormu
